alert.note: Alert for Greensville; Southampton; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 3:08PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Greensville, central Southampton and Sussex Counties and the City of Emporia through 345 PM EDT... At 307 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking outflow from a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Green Plain, or 12 miles northwest of Boykins, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Sussex around 330 PM EDT. Homeville around 340 PM EDT. Wakefield around 345 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Vicksville, Adams Grove, Grizzard, Lanes Corner, Booker, Yale, Lumberton, Emporia Reservoir, Worrell and Cowie Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and south central and southeastern Virginia.
